intro: Aralia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian aralia, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, featuring compound leaves with multiple leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically followed by red or orange berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. The botanical features of Aralia abyssinica make it a notable species in the Araliaceae family.
